oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of Metal-Organic Frameworks: capturing chemical intuition
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Machine learning
Synthesis
Optimisation
Metal-Organic frameworks
MARVEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We report a methodology using machine learning to capture chemical intuition from a set of (partially) failed attempts to synthesize a metal organic framework. We define chemical intuition as the collection of unwritten guidelines used by synthetic chemists to find the right synthesis conditions. As (partially) failed experiments usually remain unreported, we have reconstructed a typical track of failed experiments in a successful search for finding the optimal synthesis conditions that yields HKUST-1 with the highest surface area reported to date. We illustrate the importance of quantifying this chemical intuition for the synthesis of novel materials.
